name: Atypical Carcinoid Syndrome
chief_complaint: I've been having these weird flushing episodes and diarrhea that won't go away.
prognosis: Variable depending on tumor grade and spread, with 5-year survival ranging from 50-95% for localized disease
description: A neuroendocrine tumor variant that secretes vasoactive substances like serotonin, causing paroxysmal symptoms. Grows slower than typical carcinoid but can metastasize. Often originates in lungs or GI tract.
